# Data process



## China


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `da007_8_` |`da009_2_8_`|`da009_1_8_`|`ybirth`|
|-|-|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `Stroke`|`The Age of Being Diagnosed of Stroke`|`The Year of Being Diagnosed of Stroke`|`year of birth`|
| **Table name**  | `health_status_and_functioning_wave1`| `health_status_and_functioning_wave1`| `health_status_and_functioning_wave1`|`ybirth`|
| **Categories** | `1 = Yes`<br/>`2 = No` |`continuous`|`continuous`|`continuous`|
| **Missings** | `NA` | `NA` | `NA` | `999 = Missing` |
| **Description** |  |  |  |  |

```{r assign w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'CHARLS_w1_2','CHARLS.health_status_and_functioning_wave1',variables=list('da007_8_','da009_2_8_','da009_1_8_'), missings = T)
CHARLS_w1_2 <- opal.execute(o,'CHARLS_w1_2')
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'CHARLS_w1_id','CHARLS.CHARLS_w1_ids',variables=list('var'), missings = TRUE)
CHARLS_w1_id <- opal.execute(o,'CHARLS_w1_id')
load(paste0(datafolder,"w1/ybirth.RData"))

# adding a zero to the old id's in CHARLS_w1 with CHARLS_ids
CHARLS_w1_2$oldid <- CHARLS_w1_2$id
CHARLS_w1_2$id <- CHARLS_ids(ids = CHARLS_w1_2$oldid)

Add_indiv <- function(old, new){
  
  new_2 <- matrix(NA, nrow = dim(new)[1], ncol=dim(old)[2])
  oldm <- as.matrix(old)
  
  for(i in 1:length(new$id)){
    if(sum(new$id[i]==old$id)>=1){
      new_2[i,] <- oldm[which(new$id[i]==old$id),]
    } else {
      new_2[i,] <- c(new$id[i], NA,NA,NA,NA)
    }
  }
  
  new_22 <- data.frame(id=new_2[,1], oldid=as.numeric(new_2[,5]), da007_8_=as.numeric(new_2[,2]), da009_1_8_=as.numeric(new_2[,3]), da009_2_8_=as.numeric(new_2[,4]))
  new_22
}
CHARLS_w1 <- Add_indiv(old = CHARLS_w1_2, new = CHARLS_w1_id)
CHARLS_w1 <- left_join(CHARLS_w1,ybirth, by="id")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `stroke` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `change 2 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `stroke_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if stroke == 1, stroke_age = da009_1_8_ - ybirth`
* `if stroke == 1, and da009_1_8_ == NA, stroke_age = da009_2_8_`
* `if stroke == 0, stroke_age = 996`
* `otherwise into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
CHARLS_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=CHARLS_w1$id)
CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke <- car::recode(CHARLS_w1$da007_8_, "2=0; NA=999")

# Continuous variable harmonization
CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke_age <- rep(999,length(CHARLS_w1$id))
CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke_age[which(CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke == 0)] <- 996
CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke_age[which(CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke == 1 & CHARLS_w1$ybirth != 999)] <- CHARLS_w1$da009_1_8_[which(CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke == 1 & CHARLS_w1$ybirth != 999)] - CHARLS_w1$ybirth[which(CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke == 1 & CHARLS_w1$ybirth != 999)]
CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke_age[which(CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke == 1 & (is.na(CHARLS_w1$da009_1_8_) | CHARLS_w1$ybirth == 999))] <- CHARLS_w1$da009_2_8_[which(CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke == 1 & (is.na(CHARLS_w1$da009_1_8_) | CHARLS_w1$ybirth == 999))]
CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke_age <- car::recode(CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke_age, "NA=999")

# A posteriori, from wave 2 data we know the age of diagnosis of an individual:
CHARLS_ds_w1$stroke_age[which(CHARLS_ds_w1$id=="056302126002")] <- 64

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `stroke` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `change 2 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `stroke_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if stroke == 1 in w2 and w1, stroke_age = age from w1`
* `if stroke == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, stroke_age = da009_1_8_ - ybirth`
* `if stroke == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, and da009_1_8_ == NA, stroke_age = da009_2_8_`
* `if stroke == 0, stroke_age = 996`
* `otherwise into 999`



**R script:**

```{r harmo w2}

CHARLS_w2 <- left_join(CHARLS_w2,CHARLS_w1,by="id",suffix=c("","_w1"))

# Before following we correct a mistake; some years recorded in the ages variable. We record them in the diagnosed years variable.
CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_[which(CHARLS_w2$id %in% CHARLS_w2$id[which(CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_>2000)])] <- CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_[which(CHARLS_w2$id %in% CHARLS_w2$id[which(CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_>2000)])]
CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_[which(CHARLS_w2$id %in% CHARLS_w2$id[which(CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_>2000)])] <- rep(NA,length(CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_[which(CHARLS_w2$id %in% CHARLS_w2$id[which(CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_>2000)])]))

# The value CHARLS_w2$da007_8_ is missing for 257 individuals with diagnosed age or year. We update the value.
CHARLS_w2$da007_8_[which(is.na(CHARLS_w2$da007_8_) & (!is.na(CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_) | !is.na(CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_)))] <- 1

# Categorical variable harmonization
CHARLS_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=CHARLS_w2$id)
CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke <- rep(999,length(CHARLS_w2$id))
CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke[which(CHARLS_w2$da007_8_==2)] <- 0
# Individuals having stroke since wave 1, so their year of diagnostic is at least 2011 and greater than the answered in wave 1 or missing but until wave 1 they have no stroke.
CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke[which(CHARLS_w2$da007_8_==1 & (((CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_>=2011 & (CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_>CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8__w1 | is.na(CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8__w1))) | (CHARLS_w2$da007_8__w1 == 2 | is.na(CHARLS_w2$da007_8__w1)))))] <- 1

# Continuous variable harmonization
CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke_age <- rep(999,length(CHARLS_w2$id))
CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke_age[which(CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke == 0)] <- 996
# Use of diagnosed year
CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke_age[which(CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke == 1 & CHARLS_w2$ybirth>1850 & (CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_>=2011 | !CHARLS_ds_w2$id %in% CHARLS_ds_w1$id))] <- CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_[which(CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke == 1 & CHARLS_w2$ybirth>1850 & (CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_>=2011 | !CHARLS_ds_w2$id %in% CHARLS_ds_w1$id))] - CHARLS_w2$ybirth[which(CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke == 1 & CHARLS_w2$ybirth>1850 & (CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_>=2011 | !CHARLS_ds_w2$id %in% CHARLS_ds_w1$id))]
# Use of diagnosed age for the individuals the previous do not apply due to missing
CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke_age[which(CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke == 1 & (is.na(CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_) | CHARLS_w2$ybirth<1850) & (CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_ >= 2011 - CHARLS_w2$ybirth | !CHARLS_ds_w2$id %in% CHARLS_ds_w1$id) & CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_ <= 2014 - CHARLS_w2$ybirth)] <- CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_[which(CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke == 1 & (is.na(CHARLS_w2$da009_1_8_) | CHARLS_w2$ybirth<1850) & (CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_ >= 2011 - CHARLS_w2$ybirth | !CHARLS_ds_w2$id %in% CHARLS_ds_w1$id) & CHARLS_w2$da009_2_8_ <= 2014 - CHARLS_w2$ybirth)]
CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke_age <- car::recode(CHARLS_ds_w2$stroke_age, "NA=999")

```

<!--AUXILIAR FUNCTIONS-->



```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}


labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab = ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with categorical data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      # Labelling of categories (for categorical variables, only non-missing values)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- labelled(aux_object[[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label[1:(length(cat_label)-9)])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


labelling_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab=ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with continuous data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- m.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cont_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- remove_val_labels(aux_object[[vbl_name]])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


# Creation of summary tables for categorical data

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of columns with categories and labels
  t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[[1]][,4] 
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds[2+length(cat_label),] <- c("n", "sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))
  )
  # Add wave/population names
  names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label",lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


# Creation of summary tables for continuous data

summaries_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of column with summary table categories
  t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[1:6]
  # Adding of missing/no-missing values categories
  t.hds <- c(substr(t.summ,1,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)-1),labels(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[1]][[vbl_name]], missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table)[[2]])
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    # First, summary values
    t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[1:6]
    # Next, missing/no-missing values (the 1 in $values_table[1,] stands for absolute values, while a 2 would stand for percentages)
    t.hds <- cbind(t.hds,c(as.numeric(substr(t.summ,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)+1,nchar(t.summ))),as.numeric(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[i]][[vbl_name]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table[1,])))
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds <- rbind(t.hds,c("sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))))
  # Add wave/population names
  dimnames(t.hds)[[2]] <- c(dimnames(summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name]))[[2]],lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}



# Creation of trajectories table for each population

trajectories <- function(m.hds,vbl_name){
  
  # First wave data
  dbb <- m.hds[[1]][,c("id",vbl_name)]
  # Merge with next waves data
  for(ind in 2:length(m.hds)){
    dbb <- merge(dbb, m.hds[[ind]][,c("id",vbl_name)], by = "id", suffixes = c("", paste0(".",names(m.hds)[ind])), all = T)
  }
  names(dbb) <- c("id", names(m.hds))
  
  # Glue individual data through all waves into trajectories
  v.dbb <- dbb[,2]
  for(ind in 2:length(m.hds)){
    v.dbb <- paste(v.dbb,dbb[,ind+1],sep="")
  }
  # Trajectories and frequencies
  f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
  return(f.dbb)
  
}

# Save data tables

savingRD <- function(l.hds,vbl_name){
  
  for(index in seq_along(l.hds)){
    assign(vbl_name,l.hds[[index]])
    save(vbl_name,list = vbl_name, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.hds)[index],"/",vbl_name,".RData"))
  }
  
}
```
